stanza.line: So oft have I invoked thee for my musemuse
And found such fair assistance in my verseverse
As every alien pen hath got my useuse
And under thee their poesy dispersedisperse
Thine eyes that taught the dumb on high to singsing
And heavy ignorance aloft to flyfly
Have added feathers to the learned wingwing
And given grace a double majestymajesty
Yet be most proud of that which I compilecompile
Whose influence is thine and born of theethee
In others works thou dost but mend the stylestyle
And arts with thy sweet graces graced bebe
But thou art all my art and dost advanceadvance
As high as learning my rude ignoranceignorance
